Project.name: AsyncStub Utility for AS3
Project.Description: The Asynchronous Stub utility consists of a Proxy which can be extended for the purpose of simulating asynchronous activity, by way of a random timer.
Project.ReleaseNotes:
Changes in Version 1.2.5
  • No new features, but now includes multicore folder for multicore src
  • The bin folder now includes the multicore swc.
Changes in Version 1.2
  • Refactored source into src folder.
Changes in Version 1.1
  • Enhanced to cater for fault outcome, with probability of fault.
  • Provide a token tracking feature.
Features in Version 1.0
  • Uses a timer to simulate asyncronous interaction with server
  • Simulates failure
Occasionally, for testing a service before it is online, you may need a Proxy that acts as though it has asynchronously contacted a server and retrieved data. You may also need for it to simulate random load times, timeouts, and failures. This can be for testing purposes or as a stand-in until the actual service is in place so that client development can proceed. The Flex-based demo called Loadup as Ordered provides an example use of this utility.
Project.Installation:
Installing the Project Source Code From the archive
  • Download the latest source code archive
  • Unzip the source code zip to any folder on your disk. For instance:
    • c:\development\
  • You will see a AsyncStub_X_Y (where X_Y is version) source folder. For instance:
c:\development\AsyncStub_X_Y From the Repository
  • Use your favorite SVN client to retrieve the latest source code release from the repository.
Using the Utility in Your Project Add the Utility Library to your Project Using Flex Builder 3
  • Open or create a Flex or AIR Project in Flex Builder 3
  • From the Flex Builder menu, do:
    • Project -> Properties -> Flex Build Path -> Library Path -> Add SWC
  • Browse and select the SWC, for instance:
    • c:\development\AsyncStub_X_Y\bin\Utility_AS3_AsyncStub_X_Y.swc
  • Click Finish.
Add the Utility Library to your Flash/CS3/CS4 Project
  • The distributed SWC file will not work.
  • You must place the source code in your classpath.
  • Consult the CS3/CS4 documentation for the various ways to accomplish this.
